intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium subpyrenaeum, commonly known as the Pyrenean hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Iberian Peninsula and southern France. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils at high altitudes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. It is a perennial species that plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its mountainous environment.
